ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Wind Solar Wind Experiment (SWE) Faraday Cup, Solar Wind Plasma Reduced Ion Distribution Functions, 92 s Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Updated to SPASE Version 2.3.2 if needed, Applied quality control for DOI usage, LFB

ResourceHeader.Description: WIND Solar Wind Experiment, SWE, Faraday cup data: this data set contains three-dimensional measurements of ions in the energy range 150 eV to 8 keV. Placed 15Â° above and below equatorial plane of the spacecraft, the Faraday Cups measure ion charge flux as a function of epoch, cup number, orientation angle, and bias grid potential. For each time point, a full spectrum is comprised of charge flux measurements at the two Faraday cup sensors at 20 azimuth angles for each of 31 energy-per-charge windows with 1240 data points per spectrum. Spectra are built up over approximately 92 s intervals. The effective area of the Faraday cup sensor as a function of incidence angle onto the cup is also provided.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time Tags, default time at the beginning of the spectrum
Parameter.Caveats: The Epoch is defined as the number of milliseconds since 01-Jan-0000 00:00:00.000, as computed using the CDF library's internal date routines. Year zero i convention chosen by NSSDC to measure epoch values. This date is more commonly referred to a BC. Remember tha BC wa leap year. The CDF date/time calculations do not take into account the changes to the Gregorian calendar, and cannot be directly converted into Julian date/times. To convert CDF epochs into date/times and vice versa, you should only use the CDF_EPOCH routine with either the BREAKDOWN_EPOCH or CONVERT_EPOCH keywords. This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 1, Azimuth Angle of collection surface normal
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 1, Azimuth Angle of the vector normal to the cup collection surface
Parameter.Caveats: The azimuthal angle for cup 1, in degrees. This is the angle formed by the ecliptic plane component of the cup normal and the XGSE unit vector. Positive angles correspond to deflection into the YGSE direction.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 2, Azimuth Angle of collection surface normal
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 2, Azimuth Angle of the vector normal to the cup collection surface
Parameter.Caveats: The azimuthal angle for cup 2, in degrees. ed This is the angle formed by the ecliptic plane component of the cup normal and the XGSE unit vector. Positive angles correspond to deflection into the YGSE direction.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 1, Bias Potential
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 1, Bias Potential, equal to the energy per charge of admitted ions
Parameter.Caveats: For each potential window, the bias oscillates ove small range. This is the central value of the range.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 2, Bias Potential
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 2, Bias Potential, equal to the energy per charge of admitted ions
Parameter.Caveats: For each potential window, the bias oscillates ove small range. This is the central value of the range.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 1, Half Range Bias Potential
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 1, Half Range of the Bias Potential
Parameter.Caveats: For each potential window, the bias oscillates ove small range. This is the width of the range.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 2, Half Range Bias Potential
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 2, Half Range of the Bias Potential
Parameter.Caveats: For each potential window, the bias oscillates ove small range. This is the width of the range.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 1, Current, E/Q-azimuth display
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 1, Current, the total charge flux incident on the collector of cup 1, energy per charge, E/Q, azimuth display
Parameter.Caveats: The noise limit of this measurement is approximately 0.69 pA. Models of charge flow into the cup from oblique angles to the cup axis should account for projection of the aperture onto the collector. The calibrated effective area of the cup is given a function of incidence angle in the lookup table.

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup 2, Current, E/Q-azimuth display
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Faraday Cup 2, Current, the total charge flux incident on the collector of cup 2, energy per charge, E/Q, azimuth display
Parameter.Caveats: The noise limit of this measurement is approximately 0.69 pA. Models of charge flow into the cup from oblique angles to the cup axis should account for projection of the aperture onto the collector. The calibrated effective area of the cup is given a function of incidence angle in the lookup table.

Parameter.Name: SWE Instrument Mode Indicator, Tracking
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: SWE Instrument Mode Indicator, Tracking Flag, a boolean quantity signifying whether the instrument is in peak-tracking mode
Parameter.Caveats: 0=not tracking. 1=tracking. In TRACKING mode, the EperQ window with maximum current signal is identified and the EperQ scanning range is continuously adjusted such that the scan begins five windows below the peak (or at the minimum voltage).

Parameter.Name: SWE Instrument Mode Indicator, Full Scan
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: SWE Instrument Mode Indicator, Full Scan Flag, a boolean quantity signifying whether the instrument is in full-scan mode
Parameter.Caveats: 0=limited scan. 1=full scan. In full scan mode, the EperQ scanning range is the full range of the instrument. In limited scan mode, the EperQ scanning range is smaller. Typically, limited scan mode is used in conjunction with tracking in order to best resolve the ion core distributions.

Parameter.Name: Incidence Angle for effective area calibration
Parameter.Description: Incidence Angle for effective area calibration

Parameter.Name: Faraday Cup, Inclination Angles
Parameter.Caveats: Angle formed by the cup ( 2, respectively) normals with the solar ecliptic plane, in degrees.
